unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on Adaptive Learning in the Education Technology category, aiming for the specified tone, length, and Indian context:
normalised: Hey everyone, so I was just reading up on Adaptive Learning, and it is pretty cool, right? Think of it like this: remember that scene in 'three Idiots' where Rancho figures out everyone's learning style? Adaptive learning tries to do that for real, but with algorithms!

Basically, it is about tailoring education to each student's needs in real time. So, instead of everyone in class learning the same thing at the same pace, the system adjusts based on how well YOU are doing. If Priya from I I T Bombay is acing the calculus problems, she can move on to more challenging stuff. If Rohan from Delhi is struggling with basic fractions, he gets extra help and practice questions.

normalised: Imagine a digital textbook that knows exactly where you are getting stuck. That is the power of adaptive learning. Some companies are even building adaptive learning platforms that integrate with existing school systems.
